item.title: Online retailing is becoming increasingly popular for smartphones in China
item.description:
Want to expand your customer base? Consider partnering with an e-mall, especially in China. A recent IDC Mobile Phone Tracker report indicates a rise in the share of e-tailers, like JD, Alibaba’s Tmall, and Suning Yigou, in China’s smartphone market, from 14% in Q2 2014 to 21% in Q2 2015. This translates to a 58% year-on-year surge in the number of smartphones sold via these online platforms. Tay Xiaohan, a Senior Market Analyst at IDC Asia/Pacific’s Client Devices team, highlights that as operators scale back smartphone subsidies, vendors find more opportunities in the open market, with e-tailers emerging as a crucial channel...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/online-retailing-is-becoming-increasingly-popular-for-smartphones-in-china/

item.title: Shoppers are interested in clothes, cosmetics, and baby products on 11.11
item.description:
Source: Alizila blog. The 2018 11.11 Global Shopping Festival logo is illuminated in neon. Alibaba’s 2018 11.11 Global Shopping Festival is surpassing the sales of the previous year. Alizila reports show that it took a mere 1 minute and 25 seconds for the festival to reach over US$1 billion in total gross merchandise volume (GMV). By 1:15 p.m., Tmall Global had already exceeded its total GMV from the entire 2017 11...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/shoppers-are-interested-in-clothes-cosmetics-and-baby-products-on-11-11/

item.title: InPost has officially started its operations in Malaysia
item.description:
Source: InPost. InPost, a global leader in automated parcel locker networks, has expanded its services to Malaysia. The launch was accompanied by a roadshow, themed “Malaysia E-commerce Day (MED) 2015,” aimed at raising awareness about the latest advancements in e-commerce, e-payments, and logistics. According to InPost Malaysia Managing Director Rosland Mohd Jannes, the initiative seeks to connect with businesses and individuals, boosting consumer confidence in online shopping and alleviating delivery-related anxieties...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/inpost-has-officially-started-its-operations-in-malaysia/
